For Maecenas was not a man to deal with old tenants in the ruth- laes way common at the time to those who had made sudden fortunes by not over-scrupulous means, and who dealt with their new possessions without regard to the feelings or the happiness of those whom they found upon the lands they bought. These were among their country's worst enemies ; and Rome had reason in the end to rue the system which depopulated its com-growing lands, by throwing them into the hands of rich men ambitious osbeing the owners-of vast estates maintained more for show than use. ·
